results.definition: the physical condition of being stretched or strained
examples: it places great tension on the leg muscles

results.definition: feelings of hostility that are not manifest
examples: the diplomats' first concern was to reduce international tensions

results.definition: (psychology) a state of mental or emotional strain or suspense
examples: he suffered from fatigue and emotional tension

results.definition: a balance between and interplay of opposing elements or tendencies (especially in art or literature)
examples: there is a tension created between narrative time and movie time
there is a tension between these approaches to understanding history

results.definition: (physics) a stress that produces an elongation of an elastic physical body
examples: the direction of maximum tension moves asymptotically toward the direction of the shear

results.definition: the action of stretching something tight
examples: tension holds the belt in the pulleys
